text: "I've Been Lonely Too Long" is a song written Felix Cavaliere and Eddie Brigati and performed by The Young Rascals. It reached #7 in Canada, #16 on the U.S. pop chart, #17 on the Cashbox chart, and #33 on the U.S. R&B; chart in 1967. It was featured on their 1967 album Collections, where the song title is given as "Lonely Too Long". The song was produced by The Young Rascals. The song ranked #54 on Billboard magazine's Top 100 singles of 1967. ==Other versions== *Byrdie Green released a version of the song on her 1967 album I Got It Bad (And That Ain't Good). *Mercy released a version on their original Sundi Records album Love (Can Make You Happy). *The Brooklyn Bridge released a version of the song on their 1968 album Brooklyn Bridge. *The Fireballs released a version of the song on their 1969 album Come On, React! *David Cassidy released a version of the song on his 1972 album Rock Me Baby. *Richie Furay released a version of the song as a single in 1979 in the UK, but it did not chart. ==References== Category:1967 songs Category:1967 singles Category:1979 singles Category:Songs written by Felix Cavaliere Category:Songs written by Eddie Brigati Category:The Rascals songs Category:The Fireballs songs Category:David Cassidy songs Category:Song recordings produced by Norman Petty Category:Song recordings produced by Wes Farrell Category:Song recordings produced by Val Garay Category:Atlantic Records singles Category:Asylum Records singles
